block.p: Melissa Ayn Brecher, a daughter of Madeleine and George Brecher of Teaneck, N.J., is to be married this evening to Matthew Max Berman, a son of Parvaneh Horan of Portsmouth, R.I., and G. David Berman of Assonet, Mass. Rabbi Louis Sigel is to officiate at the Essex House in New York.

The bride, 27, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the copy director for the corporate sales department at the Conde Nast Publications in New York, where she oversees special advertising sections. Her father is a senior partner in Brecher, Fishman, Pasternack, Popish, Heller, Rubin & Reiff, a New York law firm. Her mother is the assistant treasurer of the National Council of Jewish Women in New York.

Melissa Ayn Brecher, a daughter of Madeleine and George Brecher of Teaneck, N.J., is to be married this evening to Matthew Max Berman, a son of Parvaneh Horan of Portsmouth, R.I., and G. David Berman of Assonet, Mass. Rabbi Louis Sigel is to officiate at the Essex House in New York.

The bride, 27, will continue to use her name professionally. She is the copy director for the corporate sales department at the Conde Nast Publications in New York, where she oversees special advertising sections. Her father is a senior partner in Brecher, Fishman, Pasternack, Popish, Heller, Rubin & Reiff, a New York law firm. Her mother is the assistant treasurer of the National Council of Jewish Women in New York.

Mr. Berman, 28, is an underwriting manager at American International Group, an insurance and financial services company in New York, where he works on Internet liability-insurance projects for its e-commerce division. He is also a candidate for an M.B.A. at New York University. His mother is an X-ray technologist at Newport (R.I.) Hospital. His father is a pharmacist at Brooks Pharmacy in Fall River, Mass. The bridegroom is a stepson of Steven Horan and of Janice Berman.
The bride and bridegroom both graduated from the University of Pennsylvania, although they did not meet until later, when they were introduced by mutual friends in New York.
